page.title: 05THE HAMLET OF GRAFTON
page.content: This forms part of the parish of Beckford and consists of 24 houses, 3 of which are farm houses. Most are of stone or part stone construction, but 3 are brick and 4 are half timbered. All were built after 1890 and have mains water and electricity with septic tank drainage. The main agricultural activity is sheep farming but a four hundred head calf rearing unit and a grain drier have recently been constructed there. With the high mechanisation of farming the future of{Grafton}as a community is likely to be as a dormitary for local towns, many of the residents already being employed outside the area. The future as a retirement area also seems to be in prospect with an increase in the number of retired residents.
